text: Harold 'Harry' Wood (28 November 1902 - 27 June 1975) was a British long- distance runner. ==Athletics career== He competed in the marathon at the 1928 Summer Olympics. He also competed for England in the marathon at the 1934 British Empire Games in London. ==Personal life== Wood was a miner by trade. ==References== Category:1902 births Category:1975 deaths Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1928 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:British male long-distance runners Category:British male marathon runners Category:Olympic athletes of Great Britain Category:Sportspeople from Wigan
title: Harry Wood (athlete)
